intro: Amparoa, commonly known as the "Mexican bellflower," is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, which includes many bell-shaped flowers. The plant produces striking blue or violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Amparoa typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its foliage consists of lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, fuzzy texture.
